txt.en: 'The Stag-clan is not as powerful as it once was, and now its people are being marginalized. If we can gain their favour, it could be that they will resist the call of Saruman.\n\n'Stay here and help the people of Trum Dreng, [placeholder]. Once you are satisfied that you have done all you can to earn their respect and favour, continue south-east into the lands of Pren Gwydh. There you will find a large village called Galtrev. Just outside this village we can meet up with Halbarad and see what must be done next as we pass through Dunland.'
'The passage through Trum Dreng went smoothly? Good. It is the same for the group that braved the Bonevales. Now we must see what awaits us here in Pren Gwydh.'

'There are a great many things that you can do in Trum Dreng to earn the favour of its people, [placeholder]. You should do everything you can here before travelling to Pren Gwydh and meeting Halbarad outside Galtrev.'
The people of Trum Dreng need your help if they are to stand against the clans siding with Saruman.
Help the people of Trum Dreng as much as you can, and when you are ready to move on, find Halbarad in Pren Gwydh

There are many things you can do in Trum Dreng to aid the Stag-clan and gain their favour. Once you have satisfied their needs, Braigiar would like you to meet up with Halbarad outside the village of Galtrev, in Pren Gwydh.
